article.headline: Missouri St. 62, Arkansas 57
article.story: SPRINGFIELD, Mo. -- Missouri State scored the last six points of the game to hold off Arkansas for a 62-57 win Saturday night. Missouri State (2-1), which had a 28-20 halftime lead, increased the margin to 34-22 with 17:05 left as Kyle Weems scored 10 of his team-leading 16 points in the first six minutes of the half. Rotnei Clarke scored 12 of Arkansas' next 14 points on the way to a 20-8 run that tied the game at 42-42 with 11:35 left. Neither team led by more than three until the final seconds of the game. After Stefan Welsh hit three of six free throws on two consecutive plays to give Arkansas (2-1) a 57-56 lead with 1:41 left, Arkansas did not score again. Missouri State's Chris Cooks finished with 15 points. Clarke had 19 for Arkansas and Courtney Fortson added 10. Michael Sanchez had 11 rebounds for Arkansas.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
